abstract: Editorial scores effort by lawmakers to grant corporate tax holiday, which would allow multinational corporations can repatriate foreign earnings at vastly reduced rates; notes, from historical data on 2004 holiday, repatriated earnings are likely to increase deficit, and will enrich shareholders and executives rather than create jobs.
snippet: A tax holiday would be a windfall for major corporations at the expense of everyone else, and it would raise the deficit.
lead_paragraph: A tax holiday would be a windfall for major corporations at the expense of everyone else, and it would raise the deficit.
